        public final int getRenderPass()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Returns a flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for. The returned value should be the bitwise-OR of any of the following flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Specified by:
        getRenderPass in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Returns:

      • draw

        public final void draw​(GLMapView view)
        Description copied from interface: GLResolvableMapRenderable
        Renders the content in the current EGL context for the given view. Initialization of the renderer may occur following instantiation or a prior call to GLMapRenderable.release().

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        The following behavior is expected for the various states during execution of this method:

        • UNRESOLVED - resolution is started and the current state transitions to RESOLVING
        • RESOLVING - the rendered graphics are updated as new data is loaded. The state will change to RESOLVED once all data has finished loading or UNRESOLVABLE if resolution fails.
        • RESOLVED - all data has been loaded and should be displayed. The state is unchanged.
        • SUSPENDED - any loaded data is displayed, however no new data should be loaded. The state is unchanged.
        • UNRESOLVABLE - the data failed to load. The state is unchanged.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLMapRenderable
        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLResolvableMapRenderable
        Parameters:
        view - The current view

      • draw

        public void draw​(GLMapView view,
                 int renderPass)
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Renders the content in the current EGL context for the given view. Initialization of the renderer may occur following instantiation or a prior call to GLMapRenderable2.release().

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Parameters:
        view - The current view
        renderPass - The render pass being executed during this invocation. The value will be the bitwise-OR of any of the flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Only content valid for the specified pass should be rendered.

      • suspend

        public void suspend()
        Description copied from interface: GLResolvable
        Resolution is suspended. If #draw(GLMapView) is invoked, any data that has already been loaded should be rendered, however, no new data should be loaded. The rest of the data may continue loading if GLResolvable.resume() is invoked.

        This method does nothing if the current state is not GLResolvable.State.RESOLVING.

        Specified by:
        suspend in interface GLResolvable

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Description copied from interface: GLResolvable
        Resolution is resumed. This method may be invoked following a call to GLResolvable.suspend() to resume loading data.

        This method does nothing if the current state is not GLResolvable.State.SUSPENDED.

        Specified by:
        resume in interface GLResolvable

      • requestUpdate

        public void requestUpdate​(int id,
                          byte[] data,
                          int dstX,
                          int dstY,
                          int dstW,
                          int dstH)
        Description copied from interface: TileReader.AsynchronousReadRequestListener
        This method is invoked while the read request is being serviced to deliver the data that is being read. Coordinates specified are always relative to the output buffer. This method may be invoked multiple times while the request is being serviced.
        Specified by:
        requestUpdate in interface TileReader.AsynchronousReadRequestListener
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the read request currently being serviced
        data - The data for the update
        dstX - The x-coordinate in the full output buffer of the update data
        dstY - The y-coordinate in the full output buffer of the update data
        dstW - The width in the full output buffer of the update data
        dstH - The height in the full output buffer of the update data

      • requestCompleted

        public void requestCompleted​(int id)
        Description copied from interface: TileReader.AsynchronousReadRequestListener
        This method is invoked when the request is successfully completed. This method will only be invoked for a read request that the TileReader.AsynchronousReadRequestListener.requestStarted(int) method had been previously invoked for.
        Specified by:
        requestCompleted in interface TileReader.AsynchronousReadRequestListener
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the read request that completed

        Specified by:
